Manifest.Name: Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 Monitoring Addendum

ProbeAction.ScriptBody:
#================================================================================= # Check for 7031 events for OCSP services for Operational awareness # # Author: Kevin Justin # v1.0 #=================================================================================
# Constants section - modify stuff here: #================================================================================= # Assign script name variable for use in event logging. $ScriptName = "Microsoft.Windows.Active.Directory.Certificate.Services.2016.OnlineResponderService.EventID7031.Monitor.DS.v1004.ps" $EventID = "661" #=================================================================================
# Starting Script section - All scripts get this #================================================================================= # Gather the start time of the script $StartTime = Get-Date #Set variable to be used in logging events $whoami = whoami # Load MOMScript API $momapi = New-Object -comObject MOM.ScriptAPI # Load PropertyBag function $bag = $momapi.CreatePropertyBag() #Log script event that we are starting task $momapi.LogScriptEvent($ScriptName,$EventID,0,"`n Script is starting. `n Running as ($whoami).") #=================================================================================
# Begin MAIN script section #================================================================================= #$ServiceName = "OCSPSvc"
$ADCSServices = @() $ADCSServices += "ARAdminSvc"
$ADCSServices
# #For a simple example - get files in Windows Temp: $date = get-date -uFormat "%Y-%m-%d"
$momapi.LogScriptEvent($ScriptName,$EventID,0,"`n Gather Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 System Event ID 7031 Alerts for date ($date).")
# Grab past 15 minutes $Time = [DateTime](Get-Date).AddMinutes(-15)
$SystemEvents = get-eventlog -LogName "System" -after $Time ` | ? { ( $_.EventID -eq 7031 )` }
$7031Events = foreach ( $Service in $ADCSServices ) { $SystemEvents | ? { ($_.Message -like "*$Service*") } }
# Create array for services messages $ADCSServiceMessage = @()
# Check if service is running if ( $7031Events.Count -eq 0 ) { write-host "ZERO Quest OCSP 7031 events found in past 15 minutes" }
if ( $7031Events.Count -gt 0 ) { foreach ( $Service in $ADCSServices ) { if ( $(get-service $Service).Status -ne "running" ) { get-service $Service; start-service $Service ; sleep 15
#Set the condition = bad. This represents your script finding something wrong $strCondition = "Bad"
$ADCSServiceMessage += "Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSPSvc service $Service NOT running after automated service restart" $momapi.LogScriptEvent($ScriptName,$EventID,0,"Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 service $Service NOT running after automated service restart") #$momapi.LogScriptEvent($ScriptName,$EventID,0,"$7031ActiveRolesMessage")
$bag.AddValue('Result','BadCondition') #$bag.AddValue('Result',$strCondition) $bag.AddValue('Count',$SystemEvents.count) $bag.AddValue('Summary',$7031ActiveRolesMessage) } } }
$ADCSServiceMessage
# Gather report data $7031ActiveRolesMessage = @()
if ( $SystemEvents.count -eq 0 ) { $7031ActiveRolesMessage += "" $7031ActiveRolesMessage += "ZERO OCSP service failures for ($date)." $7031ActiveRolesMessage += ""
$strCondition = "Good" $momapi.LogScriptEvent($ScriptName,$EventID,0,"NO OCSP 7031 events found in past 15 minutes")
$bag.AddValue('Result','GoodCondition') #$bag.AddValue('Result',$strCondition) $bag.AddValue('Count',$SystemEvents.count) $bag.AddValue('Summary',$7031ActiveRolesMessage) }
if ( $SystemEvents.count -gt 0 ) { $7031ActiveRolesMessage += "" $7031ActiveRolesMessage += "#" $7031ActiveRolesMessage += "# Number of 7031 Events with OCSP service failures" $7031ActiveRolesMessage += $SystemEvents.Count $7031ActiveRolesMessage += "" $7031ActiveRolesMessage += "# Details" $7031ActiveRolesMessage += "#========================================================" $7031ActiveRolesMessage += $7031Events | select TimeGenerated,Message $7031ActiveRolesMessage += "#========================================================" $7031ActiveRolesMessage += ""
if ( $ADCSServiceMessage.Count -gt 0 ) { $7031ActiveRolesMessage += "# OCSP service restart details" $7031ActiveRolesMessage += "#========================================================" $7031ActiveRolesMessage += $ADCSServiceMessage $7031ActiveRolesMessage += "#========================================================" $7031ActiveRolesMessage += "" } }
$7031ActiveRolesMessage
$7031ActiveRolesMessage = $7031ActiveRolesMessage | out-string
# Log messages to event $momapi.LogScriptEvent($ScriptName,$EventID,0,"$7031ActiveRolesMessage")
# Return all bags $bag
# End of script section #================================================================================= #Log an event for script ending and total execution time. $EndTime = Get-Date $ScriptTime = ($EndTime - $StartTime).TotalSeconds $momapi.LogScriptEvent($ScriptName,$EventID,0,"`n Script Completed. `n Script Runtime: ($ScriptTime) seconds.") #================================================================================= # End of script

RegExExpression.Pattern: Rev vBrick System EventID7031 Rule Alert

DisplayString.Name: Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 Monitoring Addendum
DisplayString.Description: Management Pack created to turn OFF all rules for ADCS, as the monitors look at the same event source v1.0.0.4 18 Jul 2023 - Updated DS script name v1.0.0.3 9 Jun 2022 - nCipherLog monitor v1.0.0.2 10 May 2022 - Updates for OcspSvc service and recovery task monitoring v1.0.0.1 10 Mar 2022 - Updated Certificate override v1.0.0.0 10 Jun 2020 - Created for Windows Server 2016+ ADCS (Certificate Services monitoring for Active Directory) customizations of the sealed pack. Includes overrides for rules, new rules for frequent CA events

DisplayString.Name: Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP Role Seed Class
Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP Service Seed Class
Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP subscription components
DisplayString.Description: Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services OCSP application subscription components Group targeted Discovery

DisplayString.Name: Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP Service Event ID 7031 Alerts Datasource
DisplayString.Description: This datasource generates Event ID 7031 Alerts

DisplayString.Name: Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP Role Seed Class Discovery
Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP Service Seed Class Discovery
Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP Service MonitorType
DisplayString.Description: This MonitorType is adds service monitor functionality

DisplayString.Name: Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP Service MonitorType
DisplayString.Description: This MonitorType looks at System EventID 7031 for OCSPsvc alerts

DisplayString.Name: Proactive Microsoft Windows ADCS EventLogTimer2State MonitorType
DisplayString.Description: This MonitorType looks at Events for alerts

DisplayString.Name: Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP Service EventID7031 Rule
DisplayString.Description: Created to check for System Event ID 7031's tailored for Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP Service down issues

DisplayString.Name: Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP Service System EventID7031 Rule Alert
Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP Service Monitor
DisplayString.Description: Check for Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP Service running

DisplayString.Name: Microsoft Windows OnlineResponderService OCSPSvc Service Monitor alert
Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP System Event ID 7031 Event Monitor
DisplayString.Description: Check for Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services 2016 OCSP Service running in System Event Log

DisplayString.Name: Microsoft Windows OnlineResponderService OCSPSvc Service System Event ID 7031 event alert
Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services nCipherLog HSM appliance disconnected monitor
DisplayString.Description: This monitor checks Application Event Log, Event ID 1 connection attempt failed events.

DisplayString.Name: Microsoft Windows Active Directory Certificate Services nCipherLog HSM appliance disconnected
DisplayString.Description: Application Event Log, Event ID 1 details: {0}
